main.se450.interfaces

Interface IShape

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Shape

    public interface IShape
    The interface designed to be implemented by the Shape class providing an extra level of encapsulation.
    Author:
    anthonyfruende

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Each shape will draw its own pattern, color, and size.
      void move()
      General move method.
      void move(float x, float y)
      Each shape implementing IShape with move in accordance to its x and y attributes.
      void strategicmove()
      Each shape will hold either a pass-through function or a rebound function.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        void move(float x,
          float y)
        Each shape implementing IShape with move in accordance to its x and y attributes. This overloaded move method is expected to be overwritten by each class implementing the IShape interface.
        Parameters:
        x - represents the x axis of the Cartesian Coordinate system
        y - represents the y axis of the Cartesian Coordinate system

      • move

        void move()
        General move method. This move method is expected to be overwritten by each class implementing the IShape interface.

      • strategicmove

        void strategicmove()
        Each shape will hold either a pass-through function or a rebound function. The strategicmove method is expected to be overwritten by each class implementing the IShape interface.

      • draw

        void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Each shape will draw its own pattern, color, and size. The draw method is expected to be overwritten by each class implementing the IShape interface.
        Parameters:
        g - holds the reference to a Graphics class to be implemented for drawing objects.
        See Also:
        Graphics
